Comment: My previous employer has a federal government contract, and saw the opportunity for more contracts in the void of the federal cybersecurity force having been nearly completely gutted.  So they laid off nearly all of their black, brown, women, and LGBT employees to make themselves look more appealing for federal government contract bidding, making ~20% of their workforce unemployed within a few months of Trump being elected.  Yeah, actions like that tend to create more jobless claims. Before the chuds out there see this as a win for white power- they’re not refilling these roles with white men.  The industry by and large is entering a cascading hiring freeze, and I’m sure other industries impacted by the direct action of knowingly negligent social and economic policies are following suit.

Author: nasalevelstuff

Comment: Sweetheart, 2020 wasn’t anywhere near a depression. And last time, Trump actually helped out average Americans who were out of work. This time it’ll be orders of magnitude worse. It’ll be a second Great Depression, and this time he won’t be helping out us little guys.     Fun and completely unrelated Fact: I took Econ 101 and 102 in like 2013. The instructor was a typical supply side, anti-federal reserve kind of guy. He once said, “We never had a depression until after the Federal Reserve was created.” The truth is that we had a boom and bust cycle in the late 1800s, which is what prompted the creation of the Federal Reserve. He didn’t believe me. So then I replied with, “If we’ve only ever had one depression, then why is it called the GREAT Depression?” To his credit, he said, “Hunh“ and did some research and later admitted he was wrong. But this was a guy with an Econ degree teaching Econ at a community college, and he didn’t know basic American economic history.
